file_content.text: No. Father did this! A trick! It has to be.
This has nothing to do with Valkorion. You brought it on yourself when you attacked my people.
You caused this, not him.
You can't be foolish enough to believe that. Father drove you to this. You've been his puppet all along.
I've made no secret of my goal. Neither you nor Arcann were worthy of my legacy.
He turned on his family, Outlander. His own flesh and blood. It's only a matter of time before he betrays you, too.
This isn't over. Even now, my daughter is a threat.
Oh, Father. You know me so well.
We're losing altitude!
Something's dragging us down to the surface... along with every other ship in orbit!
I have no more power over Vaylin. Only you are strong enough to stop this.
The Eternal Throne is mine!
This isn't about the throne. It's about stopping you.
I never wanted it.
The Eternal Fleet just retreated. Every single ship... gone.
Enemy lines have broken! It's a rout! They're surrendering by the thousands!
My sister's rage was the only thing giving her troops the will to fight.
Then it's over. We've won.
We won.
I still can't believe Vette's gone.
She sacrificed herself for the sake of others. Taking out the enemy artillery guns saved countless lives.
She was a true hero.
We will honor her memory... along with everyone who fell defending Odessen.
Commander. Urgent distress call coming in from Empress Acina.
Dromund Kaas is under attack. The Eternal Fleet is bombing us from orbit.
We won't abandon an ally. I'm sending our fleet, Empress--with the Gravestone at its head.
This reaches far beyond the borders of the Sith Empire. The Republic is also under attack.
I'm picking up urgent distress signals from Coruscant and the other Core Worlds.
We know Vaylin didn't order this. The GEMINI captains must have gone rogue.
There's more. Emergency calls coming in from Zakuul. The Eternal Fleet set up a blockade. They're bombing them into oblivion.
Valkorion, what did you do?
Valkorion's behind this!
You caused this, not I.
The Eternal Throne sits empty. Leaderless, the fleet has reverted to its most primal function: extermination.
Unchecked, they will destroy all life in the galaxy. There is only one way to stop them. Claim the Eternal Throne and seize your destiny.
Ready the Gravestone. We're going to Zakuul.
I'm stronger than you, Vaylin. Admit it.
It's no trick. I beat you.
Throw down your weapons. This doesn't have to end with your death.
Surrender and live.
Valkorion gave you a piece of his power. Why?
Do you really think Valkorion will let me live? And you, just a pawn.
The throne needs a strong ruler. Someone like me.
You can't stop me!
We're losing altitude!
Forget the throne. Forget everything.
It's over, Vaylin.
The Eternal Fleet just turned tail and ran! The whole fleet!
Without Vaylin to drive them, her troops have no will to fight.
We did it. We won.
Not yet. This doesn't end until I'm sitting on the Eternal Throne.
We lost many lives defending Odessen.
She's not the only one.
And they all gave their lives for you. The least we can do is honor their memories.
I still can't believe Torian's gone.
If she was stronger, she'd still be alive.
She was weak.
Turn your back on everyone weaker than you, eventually you stand alone.
He sacrificed himself so our cause could live on.
He was a true hero.
We will honor his memory... along with everyone who fell defending Odessen.
He was a soldier. Soldiers die during war.
It was his duty.
We can still honor his memory. It's the least we can do.
If he was stronger, he'd still be alive.
He was weak.
I rejected your offer to join forces, remember? Deal with them yourself.
None of this affects us. Let the Eternal Fleet wipe out our enemies, then we clean up the mess.
Good. Let them burn.
You cannot ignore this.
I won't sit by while the Eternal Fleet wipes out billions of lives!
We have to help them.
You cannot solve this with your armies and fleets.
She'll bring the entire base crashing down on us!
She's tearing the entire base apart!
We need to talk about Vaylin's death. Her lifeforce flowed into you when you struck her down. Just like Arcann's.
We need to talk about my sister's death. I felt something when you struck her down. Like her lifeforce flowed into you.
I've consumed many spirits over the years. This felt no different.
This happened once before... when Valkorion died.
Unlike my father, Vaylin didn't have the power to transfer her spirit to a new host.
Maybe you're right. Unlike my father, Vaylin didn't have the power to transfer her spirit from host to host.
It's possible you simply absorbed her strength, while her spirit was obliterated. I hope that's all it was.
If Vaylin was alive, I think I would sense her--like Valkorion.
I don't sense her presence.
Are you saying Vaylin's not really dead? Or do you think Valkorion is up to something?
You think this is a trick?
Vaylin's spirit could be destroyed, trapped, or wandering Odessen. It makes no difference to me.
I don't care about her fate.
Not if Father is preventing it. I have no proof, but we both know he can't be trusted. Be careful.
I don't know. Something strange happened, and we both know my father can't be trusted. Be careful.
Don't ignore what happened. I have no proof, but I'm afraid Valkorion may be up to something. Be careful.
Valkorion's been pushing me to destroy his children. You think he's up to something?
You think this is a trick?
Valkorion's children were both powerful, angry, and violent. Their spirits wouldn't just fade peacefully away when they die.
That's not surprising.
Vaylin was weak. She didn't deserve her power, so I took it. That's all that matters.
I consumed her strength.
Perhaps, but I don't trust Valkorion. I fear he's still plotting... something. Be careful.
It's not them I'm worried about. We both know Valkorion can't be trusted. He's up to something. Be prepared.
He's always up to something. I have no proof. Only suspicions. But you know he can't be trusted. Watch your back.
It's not just the Sith who are under attack, Commander!
If Vaylin was still alive inside me somehow, wouldn't I notice?
I don't feel any different.
We're dealing with our own crisis, Acina. You're on your own.
